Simplifience

noun \ˈsim-plə-ˌfīən(t)s\ from English, 'Simplified Science'
  1. Math & science less the accumulated cruft of history.

Here’s the ground rules:

I’m going to tell you about the world in an article that looks something like this. There might even be pictures sometimes.

Throughout it all, There’s going to be some side commentary going on in colored boxes. Different colors mean different things.

Like this. It's an info box, which is uncategorized commentary.

We also have science boxes,

They'll tell you about science experiments or clarify science points.

math boxes,

Where you can often find links to more rigorous proofs.

and interdisciplinary boxes.

Where I leave notes to all you biologists, chemists, computer scientists, musicians, artists, & the rest of you out there.

We have definition boxes, which are very important.

In these I define words that you might not know (or new phrases that I've made up).

We have rigor boxes.

Where I let you know that I've been lying for the sake of simplicity.

Perhaps most importantly, we have wrong boxes where I discuss something that pervades common mathematics and science which is nevertheless a bad explanation. They’re wrong as in confusing, not necessarily wrong as in incorrect.

$\pi$, $i$, $p=mv$, $e^{i\pi}=1$
The force of gravity
a squared + b squared = c squared

I won’t explain the wrong things in my main articles, nor will I explain why they’re wrong. I don’t want to muddle the point. Red boxes are your indication that the mainstream has something muddled.

And, finally, we have simplifience boxes.

Where I point out concepts that embody the spirit of simplifience.
